thread.section_title: The Orange County Register - News Headlines : Lake Forest-Laguna Hills
thread.title: CHP investigating reports of shots fired on 241 freeway
thread.title_full: CHP investigating reports of shots fired on 241 freeway

author: JOSHUA SUDOCK
title: CHP investigating reports of shots fired on 241 freeway
text:
CHP investigating reports of shots fired on 241 freeway Jan. 10, 2017 SEND PDF 
The California Highway Patrol was investigating a report of roadway violence and possible shots fired on the northbound 241 toll road on Lake Forest and Mission Viejo on Tuesday night, according California Highway Patrol Officer Agustin Latosquin. 
The incident occurred on the 241, between Los Alisos Boulevard and Portola Parkway, around 6:40 p.m. while the parties were stopped along the roadway, Latosquin said. Both parties left the scene. 
A man called police and paramedics from his Irvine home and was treated for undisclosed injuries, Latosquin said. 
“It’s very early on in the investigation, so we’re not releasing much information about this incident just yet,” Latosquin said, “... but we’ll be releasing more over the next few hours.” 
A SigAlert was issued for the two right lanes of the northbound 241, from just north of Los Alisos to Portola Parkway -- about a mile -- at around 7 p.m. as investigators worked to preserve the crime scene and scour the area for evidence, Latosquin said. No traffic delays were reported. 
The SigAlert would be in effect until further notice. 
Officers did not believe there was an immediate safety threat to residents in the area. 
Anyone with information about this incident can submit anonymous tips to Orange County Crime Stoppers at 855-TIP-OCCS (855-847-6227). 
Contact the writer: 714-796-7802 or
